result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Chippewa County cases 13CF500, 15CF247, 15CF249, 15CF384, 15CF250 and uncharged DA cases #14-2548 and 14-137 dismissed and read-in.

miscConds.notes:
To be determined.
Pursuant to Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 12/29/2015, $12,924.58 represents restitution plus $1,292.46 restitution surcharge.
Pursuant to Amended Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 12/21/2016, $10,924.58 represents restitution plus $1,292.46 restitution surcharge.  Defendant had a cash bond posted that was applied to restitution.

Drug Reimbursement Buy Money is to be determined, if any.  Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact, directly or indirectly, with:  Jessica P. without prior written consent of the agent.    Not to associate with anyone using, possessing or distributing illegal drugs.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Submit a DNA sample.  Give complete and truthful debriefing regarding any crimes committed in Chippewa County and regarding illegal drug activities.  Testify truthfully if called to testify.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Forfeit all seized property.
